etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in McCrae's Evidence before Commissioner Bigge. Alteration of snapper after German schnappen snap

definitions: A pinkish silver fish of warm temperate coastal seas in the western Pacific, Pagrus auratus (family Sparidae), caught for food especially in southern Australia and New Zealand.

notes.text: Also called snapper. Compare "cockney". The red sea bream of Japan, Pagrus major, is regarded by some zoologists as a variety of the same species.
